title: 109_hr6100
content: The "Military Education Enhancement Opportunities Act of 2006" allows certain active-duty personnel to enroll under the Montgomery GI Bill. The "Military Education Enhancement Opportunities Act of 2006" permits eligible active-duty personnel to enroll for basic educational assistance under Chapter 30 of title 38, United States Code. The Secretary of each military department must establish procedures for individuals to make an irrevocable election within one year of the enactment of this section. An individual eligible for educational assistance under the "Military Education Enhancement Opportunities Act of 2006" must have first joined the Armed Forces between January 1, 1977, and July 1, 1985, served continuously on active duty, not enrolled in chapter 32 educational benefits program, and completed secondary school diploma requirements before making an election. To be eligible for educational assistance under the "Military Education Enhancement Opportunities Act of 2006," an individual must have completed secondary school diploma requirements and received an honorable discharge from active duty. Upon making an election, the individual's basic pay will be reduced until the total reduction reaches $2,700. The individual's basic pay will be reduced until it reaches $2,700, at which point the Secretary concerned will collect the remaining amount or reduce the retired/retainer pay by the difference. There is an 18-month period for the individual to pay the amount due after making an election under this section. The Secretary, in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense, shall provide notice of the opportunity to elect under this section. The Secretary, in conjunction with the Secretary of Defense, shall provide notice of the opportunity to elect to become entitled to basic educational assistance under this chapter. Conforming amendments are made to sections 3013(d) and 3017(b)(1) of the title. A clerical amendment is also made to the table of sections in chapter 30 of the title. Active-duty personnel have the opportunity to enroll for basic educational assistance under this chapter.
